meanings.definition: A point directly opposite another point on the earth's surface.
meanings.sent1: The antipoles of the globe are the points that are diametrically opposite each other.
meanings.sent2: She and her friend live on antipoles of the world, one in the east and the other in the west.
meanings.sent3: In a playful game, they joked that their tastes in food were like antipoles, one loving spicy food and the other preferring bland.
meanings.sent4: Their personalities were like antipoles, one being outgoing and the other introverted.
meanings.sent5: The concept of antipoles helps us understand the idea of complete opposition in geography.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is the exact opposite of another.
meanings.sent1: The twins were like antipoles in their personalities, one being loud and the other quiet.
meanings.sent2: The villain in the story was the antipoles of the hero, always causing trouble.
meanings.sent3: Their fashion styles were like antipoles, one preferring bright colors while the other liked neutral tones.
meanings.sent4: In the debate, their arguments were like antipoles, one supporting the idea while the other vehemently opposing it.
meanings.sent5: The concept of antipoles in characters makes storytelling more interesting and dynamic.
